result.execSummary:
The defendant John T Rhymes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Discharging Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: with credit for 6 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: With work release privileges, defendant to report by 4pm on 1-11-2016.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Discharging Firearm w/in 100 Yards/Bldg

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John T Rhymes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John T Rhymes in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded as to count 1:    Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 6 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve  30 days in the House of Correction with work release privileges, defendant to report by 4pm on 1-11-2016.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Sentencing Referral; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant John T Rhymes in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pre-trial.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
Court ordered jury trial date of 12/16/15 vacated. Case adjourned in branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John T Rhymes in court with attorney Kevin Brian Dunn.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Dunn is just meeting defendant for first time today.  He received additional discovery today.  Defense is requesting that the 10-5-15 trial date be vacated.  Court will vacate date and set new FPT and JT  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John T Rhymes in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Kevin Dunn was appointed by SPD to represent defendant.  NO APPEARANCE by counsel.  The court will adjourn to 10-2-2015 for final pretrial.  Defendant is given contact information for counsel by bailiff.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Request for modification of the No Contact.  State opposes. Court would consider amending No Contact Order if allowed by Family Court Order after today's date.

Defendant John T Rhymes in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. At request of Branch 38, court VACATED the Final Pretrial date, and rescheduled matter for Final Pretrial in branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

CASE SET IN ERROR ON AUGUST 7, 2015, BRANCH 38 WILL NOT BE IN SESSION.
Branch 23 will re-set the final pretrial date on July 7 at the Bail hearing appearance.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant John T Rhymes in court with attorney A Joseph Williams.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Defense counsel further requests case be set for Bail/Bond Hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant John T Rhymes in court.  Defendant in court PRO SE.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for SPD appointment of counsel. Case is adjourned for Status of Counsel date to allow for SPD to appoint counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond that was previously signed to remain. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.C.R., Tiffani C., Steven C. or the address of 3239 W. Mckinley Blvd

Defendant John T Rhymes in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.23.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/6/15 @ 1:30 pm
